verses.plain: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

tokens.t: The king shall joy in thy strength, O
; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

verses.plain: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

tokens.t: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

verses.plain: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

tokens.t: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

verses.plain: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

tokens.t: He asked life of thee,
thou gavest
him,
length of days for ever and ever.

verses.plain: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

tokens.t: His glory
great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

verses.plain: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

tokens.t: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

verses.plain: For the king trusteth in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

tokens.t: For the king trusteth in the
, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

verses.plain: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

tokens.t: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

verses.plain: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the LORD shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

tokens.t: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the
shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

verses.plain: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

tokens.t: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.plain: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

tokens.t: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device,
they are not able

verses.plain: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

tokens.t: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back,
thou shalt make ready
upon thy strings against the face of them.

verses.plain: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.

tokens.t: Be thou exalted,
, in thine own strength:
will we sing and praise thy power.

footnotes.text: made him most…: Heb. set him to be blessings
made him exceeding…: Heb. make him glad with joy
shalt thou…: or, thou shalt set them as a butt
